1: The film's gripping plot, combined with stellar performances, kept the audience engaged from start to finish.
(1) The film was boring and failed to capture the audience's attention.
(2) The performances were good, but the plot was weak.
(3) The film was engaging because of its compelling plot and excellent performances.
(4) The audience lost interest in the film halfway through.
2: Despite being widely regarded as one of the most talented musicians of his generation, his lack of formal training has often been seen as a limitation.
(1) His lack of formal training has overshadowed his talent as a musician.
(2) His musical talent is widely recognized, but people believe his lack of training hinders him.
(3) People view his formal training as more important than his talent.
(4) His lack of formal training makes him less talented than other musicians.
3: While the internet has revolutionized communication, it has also created challenges such as misinformation and privacy concerns.
(1) The internet has solved all communication problems but has introduced new challenges.
(2) The internet has improved communication but also brought about issues like misinformation and privacy concerns.
(3) Communication has been unaffected by the rise of the internet, as it has only created privacy issues.
(4) Misinformation and privacy concerns are the only problems caused by the internet’s impact on communication.
4: Many historians argue that the economic stability of a country is directly linked to its education system, which prepares future generations for the workforce.
(1) The education system is unimportant for a country’s economic stability.
(2) A strong education system ensures the economic success of future generations.
(3) Education is irrelevant when it comes to a country’s economic stability.
(4) Economic stability is determined solely by the current workforce, not future generations.
